xxl.core.cursors.filters
Class Sampler<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.filters.Filter<E>
          xxl.core.cursors.filters.Sampler<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by this iteration.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<E>, Cursor<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Sampler
public class Sampler<E>
extends Filter<E>

A sampler is a filter that generates a sample of the elements contained in a given input iteration. The sample is taken by filtering the underlying iteration which delivers randomly distributed double values by wrapping a pseudo random number generator (PRNG), namley an instance of the class ContinuousRandomNumber. This pseudo random number generator has to deliver randomly distributed double values in range [0, 1]. These double values are compared with the user specified parameter p (probability) and depending on this parameter a decision whether an element of the underlying iteration is taken for the sample or not is determined. For that case the parameter p represents the Bernoulli probability. p can be choosen in range (0, 1]. If the randomly distributed double value created by the given pseudo random number generator is lower than p, the current element of the input iterator is returned to the caller, because the internal used predicate returns true, otherwise this predicate returns false, so the next method of the underlying iteration is called without returning the delivered element, i.e., this element will not be contained in the sample.

Example usage : 

   Sampler<Integer> sampler = new Sampler<Integer>(
       new Enumerator(21),
       new ContinuousRandomNumber(new JavaContinuousRandomWrapper()),
       0.5 // Bernoulli probability
   );
   
   sampler.open();
   
   while (sampler.hasNext())
       System.out.println(sampler.next());
       
   sampler.close();
This example demonstrates the sampler functionality. The sampler returns a sample of the underlying enumerator delivering one of the enumerator's elements with a Bernoulli probability of '0.5'. That means, half of the enumerator's elements will be returned on the average. In this example Java's random number generator is used, but also Colt's random number generators are supported, therefore XXL's connectivity package and xxl.core.util providing wrapper classes for Colt (see package xxl.connectivity.colt).

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, Filter

Constructor Detail

Sampler

public Sampler(Iterator<E> iterator,
               ContinuousRandomNumber crn,
               double p)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new sampler based on an instance of the class ContinuousRandomNumber and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
iterator - the iterator containing the elements the sample is to be created from.
crn - a continuous random number cursor wrapping a PRNG.
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e., the probabilty the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p must be in range (0,1].
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].

Sampler

public Sampler(Iterator<E> iterator,
               double p)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new sampler based on an instance of the class ContinuousRandomNumber using the class Random as default PRNG and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
iterator - the iterator containing the elements the sample is to be created from.
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e., the probabilty the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p mustbe in range (0,1].
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].

Sampler

public Sampler(Iterator<E> iterator,
               double p,
               long seed)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new sampler based on an instance of the class ContinuousRandomNumber using the class Random as default PRNG with a given seed and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
iterator - the iterator containing the elements the sample is to be created from.
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e., the probabilty the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p must be in range (0,1].
seed - the seed to the pseudo random number generator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].
